cab.content: confidential.(53) 82 COPY NO.2nd MARCH, 1953.CABINETEXPENDITURE ON ADULT EDUCATIONNote by the Secretary of the CabinetI circulate, by direction of the Prime Minister, a copy of aletter which he has received from the General Secretary of the Trades UnionCongress.The question of expenditure on adult education is to be considered further by the Cabinet on Tuesday, 3rd March.(Signed) NORMAN brook cabinet Office, S.W.1.2nd March, 1953.Dear Prime Minister,Adult Education GrantsAt their meeting on 25th February, the General Council of theTrades Union Congress unanimously endorsed a resolution which had been previously adopted by their Education Committee and sent to the Minister ofEducation, on the subject of the Minister's proposed reduction of the grants to voluntary bodies and to universities responsible for adult education classes. Theresolution is as follows:-"The Trades Union Congress Education Committee have learnt with greatconcern of the decision of the Minister of Education to reduce the Ministry'sgrants for adult education by ten per cent. They believe that this cutmust inevitably result in a reduction of the very good work now being done.They re-affirm their belief that the maintenance - and, indeed, the expansion -of the adult educational services are essential to the well-being of the country^They are satisfied that in no branch of the large and important field forwhich the Minister is responsible does the nation get better value for themoney expended: to every pound so provided there are added voluntary contributions and voluntary services by the organisations which accept responsibility for the provision of adult classes. The Trades Union Congressgladly identify themselves with the large body of public opinion which asksthe Minister to reverse this most reactionary decision. "I am now instructed to bring the terms of this resolution directly to your notice.Sincerely yours,(Signed) Vincent Tewson.
